name: Inn at Northrup Station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The majority of reviews here detail this excellent Portland choice and we second all that is said. After a two week trip through the state we ended here at the Inn at Northup Station and found this inn to be the last of unique accomodation we enjoyed (through the trip we stayed at a beach cottage, a B & B, a riverboat and a parochial school). Our last stop was like living in a Jetson world - modern, sleek and neon.
reviews.title: Staying with the Jetsons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spacious rooms, full suite accomodation with all the kitchen amenities possible, clean, comfortable beds, lounging areas (large bureau, full sofa, large arm chair, counter with stools, desk with chair etc) and two TV's. Bathroom was spacious and very clean. Had a first floor "patio" with table and chairs - faced the street (which we disagree with some reviews- it was not noisy at all, even with the street car right outside - very adequate sound proofing). Room was well lit and had a large sliding door with more light. There is a rooftop type outdoor lounge area which was nice at night with tables/chairs/umbrellas and a gas grill for use also.
reviews.title: Colorful, Convenient, and Comfortable

reviews.text: Get up early for some continental breakfast - and take back to room if eating area is crowded (which it can be). If you miss this - no problem because this Nob Hill area (all very walkable within blocks) is a mecca of all types of restaurants, coffee houses, shopping, gourmet food markets and even a great independant film theatre. The location in this neighborhhod is excellent - and I couldn't imagine staying in "downtown" Portland as an option. Area had great diversity in offerings and was very safe day or night. Location also had good highway access in all directions as well as easy access to downtown area. Pretty straight shot to Voodoo Donuts, Triple A ballpark, and zoo and park areas.
reviews.title: A great stay in Portland

reviews.text: Free street car right outside was great perk getting where you need to go or decide to explore - frequency of street cars was very adequate and they were clean ( in comparison to NYC/Boston - for example). Plenty of on-site parking also. Staff was very nice and helpful.
reviews.title: Lots of color

reviews.text: Definite right choice - and day-glo fun too.
reviews.title: Funky, Friendly, Functional

likes.liked: — Large rooms, location on streetcar line

reviews.text: Our family (2 adults and 3 young kids) stayed at Northrup for 4 nights and had a great experience.
reviews.title: Great Family Stay

reviews.text: We chose Northrup for a number of reasons including kitchen in suite (almost a must with small children), breakfast in the morning, in a quiet part of the downtown core, close to shopping and free parking. The Nob Hill area is just beautiful with lots of shops and restaurants, but also reasonably close to many of the city family attractions (zoo, Children's museums, Jamieson Square, etc.).
reviews.title: Friendly and cute... but NOISY

reviews.text: The staff were very helpful in finding restaurants in the area to suit our needs.
reviews.title: Great Location and Hotel

reviews.text: The complimentary breakfast is a nice perk with young kids who can't sit still for very long in a restaurant, and worse case you could always take it back to your room.
reviews.title: Funky decor
Comfortable, Eclectic
reviews.text: Our room faced the street and had a nice balcony to sit out on at night to watch life pass by. For the kids, they just loved to sit on the deck and watch the streetcar go by.

I have stayed twice at the Inn at Northup Station - love this place! The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable about the area, and the hotel itself is very conveniently located - just walk out the door and hop on the street car (you'll get a free ticket each day), or eat at one of the local restaurants. The rooms are large and very well fitted out (kitchen with most things you'd need, two television sets, lounge area, desk/chair). The bathrooms are nice-sized, with a large tub, and sink/counter area. The decor is "fun." Generous breakfast is included (bagels, cream cheese, waffles, cereal, fruit, juice, coffee), and, for the sweet tooth, jars of candy in the lounge. I'll be back.
reviews.title: Love this hotel!

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights and thought the hotel and its staff were great. We'd looked at the reviews on tripadvisor and seen the photos on the hotel website and when we got there it was even better than we'd hoped!

reviews.title: Great Room, Great Location, Few Quirks!

likes.liked: — Fantastic room with great bed and lots of space to lounge and relax.

description: The Inn at Northrup Station --- Northwest Portland's only all-suite boutique hotel! Located along Portland's celebrated streetcar line, the Inn at Northrup Station features 70, full-appointed suites each complete with a marble and granite kitchen or wet-bar, king or queen beds, sitting area and executive desk. The hotel features a stunning lobby with arresting display of local artwork. A rooftop deck provides a unique setting for outdoor events during warm weather months. Off-street parking is available on a first come, first served basis. The Inn is located immediately adjacent to some of Portland finest five star restaurants and just one block from Good Samaritan Hospital.
